result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas G. Ratliff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
All financials same as noted above.

Huber / work release granted for any purpose the Law allows.
Good time.  
Provide a DNA sample if he hasn't already done one.
All financials same as noted above.

Huber / work release granted for any purpose the Law allows.
Good time.
Concurrent with: Count 1

records.addlTxt: Defendant Thomas G. Ratliff in court with attorney John Scott Bartholomew.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing requested.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Thomas G. Ratliff in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Retainer fee needed of $1200.  He has a little less than half.  Judge requests he pay in the $550 this week to the Clerk's office for an attorney.  Atty hired may contact the Clerks office for the money.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Thomas G. Ratliff in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Explains to the Judge how much he has saved for a retainer.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is allowed contact with J.M.

Defendant Thomas G. Ratliff in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Currently in Huber, looking for counsel.  Victim present and wants contact.  Went to Safe Haven and wrote a letter to the Court.  Court amends bond and lifts the no contact provision.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Thomas G. Ratliff in court, in custody.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Letter from victim w/Safe Haven notice.  Victim must be present before court agrees to lift the no contact order.  Defendant needs more time to hire counsel.  Bond continues with all conditions.  Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
that victim attended advocacy session at Safe Haven
Given in court.
Defendant would like to hire private attorney.  Atty Weerts released from the case.  Bond remains the same.

Defendant Thomas G. Ratliff appeared by video means with Attorney Steven E. Weerts. Prosecuting Atty Catharine D. White appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 11, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Thomas G. Ratliff in court with attorney Steven E. Weerts.  Defendant Thomas G. Ratliff in custody.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  DA advises the Court that this should be a felony DV case and he will be filing an amended criminal complaint.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 28, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
